data.meanings: It (food) was wholesome or approved in its result, easy to swallow, not attended by trouble, quick in digesting, light to the stomach, to descend well, to be salubrious in its air (land), in the habit of doing what is approved and shunning what is held base, preserve the soul from filthy actions, to be possessed of manly perfection or manly virtue or moral goodness, give food (on the occasion of building a house or marrying).
data.sentence: The word وَامْرَأَتُهُ comes from the root م ر ا and is associated with the meanings: It (food) was wholesome or approved in its result, easy to swallow, not attended by trouble, quick in digesting, light to the stomach, to descend well, to be salubrious in its air (land), in the habit of doing what is approved and shunning what is held base, preserve the soul from filthy actions, to be possessed of manly perfection or manly virtue or moral goodness, give food (on the occasion of building a house or marrying).

data.meanings: bore it, carried it, took it up, carried it, convey, show/manifest, conceive.
data.sentence: The word حَمَّالَةَ comes from the root ح م ل and is associated with the meanings: bore it, carried it, took it up, carried it, convey, show/manifest, conceive.

data.meanings: aid/assist, incites/urges/instigates, slander, collect (e.g. firewood), firewood, collector of firewood.
data.sentence: The word الْحَطَبِ comes from the root ح ط ب and is associated with the meanings: aid/assist, incites/urges/instigates, slander, collect (e.g. firewood), firewood, collector of firewood.
